result.name: nsi-profile
result.notes:
The National Soil Inventory (NSI) profile data is a spatial, point dataset with 6127 points, located in a 5km grid across England and Wales. NSI profile provides a very detailed description of the soil profile at the NSI point. From the texture of the soil to the mottle size and colour, many observations are recorded within this fundamental dataset. Because of the detail of this survey, it is easy to get a good understanding of the soils at the NSI points. Combining
this data with chemical NSI data from the NSI topsoil datasets may reveal otherwise hidden trends in the soils of England and Wales.

organization.name: cranfield-university
organization.title: Cranfield University
organization.description:
The Cranfield Soil and AgriFood Institute (CSAI), incorporating the former National Soil Resources Institute (NSRI), is a centre within Cranfield University, and maintains this extensive geographic database of land-related data, covering England and Wales. 

http://www.cranfield.ac.uk/

result.title: NSI profile

extras.value: The information contained in LandIS is copyright and its use is therefore subject to a specific licensing agreement between Cranfield University and the user. Depending on the status of the user, the cost can vary from a fully commercial charge for data lease to being royalty free with a small charge for extraction and preparation of the data to meet the user's needs.
Cranfield Soil and Agrifood Institute, Cranfield University (pointOfContact)
